# mach_header

macOS 10.6+

```
struct mach_header {
    ...
};
```

## [Topics](/documentation/kernel/mach_header#topics)

### [Instance Properties](/documentation/kernel/mach_header#1606724)

[`cpusubtype`](/documentation/kernel/mach_header/1525896-cpusubtype)[`cputype`](/documentation/kernel/mach_header/1525625-cputype)[`filetype`](/documentation/kernel/mach_header/1525892-filetype)[`flags`](/documentation/kernel/mach_header/1525711-flags)[`magic`](/documentation/kernel/mach_header/1525759-magic)An integer containing a value identifying this file as a 32-bit Mach-O file. Use the constant `MH_MAGIC` if the file is intended for use on a CPU with the same endianness as the computer on which the compiler is running. The constant `MH_CIGAM` can be used when the byte ordering scheme of the target machine is the reverse of the host CPU.[`ncmds`](/documentation/kernel/mach_header/1525650-ncmds)[`sizeofcmds`](/documentation/kernel/mach_header/1525712-sizeofcmds)## [See Also](/documentation/kernel/mach_header#see-also)
